title: 處境難題2：又係咩策略先可以唔使死

replies.msg:
背景：又係獄長同你同埋獄友玩遊戲，贏左放你地走，輸左處決你地

設定：每人(你、獄長、獄友)獲發一張A,一張K (不用理會花色)，每個回合選擇展示其中一張牌，總共玩9個回合。

整個遊戲進行的次序如下：

1.獄友與你商討策略數小時，而獄長會旁聽並完全知悉你們的計劃

2.獄友與你各自囚禁在不同的房間，無法再以任何方式溝通

3.你得知獄長接下來每一個回合會展示什麼牌，例如 AKAKAKAKK，但獄友不會知道

4.每個回合中，三人同時展示一張牌，純文字結果會在房間裡的螢光幕上顯示，例如 你:A 長:K 友:A

5.如果三個人展示的牌相同，此回合為己方勝，否則己方判負

6.如此類推重覆第4-5步，共玩9個回合

獄長放你們走的條件：
初級難度-己方勝出5個回合或以上 (高級難度-己方勝出6個回合或以上)

問題：有什麼策略可以保證100%成功?
無人有興趣?

此回覆已被刪除

quote.msg: 無人有興趣?

replies.msg: LM

replies.msg:
咁你可以諗點先可以估中4次，非常簡單
同埋呢條問題完全不用計Probability的

澄清一點，第3步:你得知獄長接下來每一個回合會展示什麼牌
係講緊你未出牌之前就知道哂佢9個回合會點出
係咪第一回合之前，獄長九回合個出牌就固定左，定每次臨出之前你先會知？

quote.msg:
澄清一點，第3步:你得知獄長接下來每一個回合會展示什麼牌
係講緊你未出牌之前就知道哂佢9個回合會點出

replies.msg:
所以個順序應該係
討論策略》獄長聽完策略諗晒九張牌話你知〉然後開始遊戲 ？

replies.msg:
4次非常簡單 講下比啲完全唔知道做緊咩既巴絲打:
1~4回合 自己出既係5~8回合獄長會出既牌 咁友就可以係5~8出到相應既牌 咁就可以保証至少估中4次

quote.msg:
澄清一點，第3步:你得知獄長接下來每一個回合會展示什麼牌
係講緊你未出牌之前就知道哂佢9個回合會點出

所以個順序應該係
討論策略》獄長聽完策略諗晒九張牌話你知〉然後開始遊戲 ？

replies.msg: 完全正確
諗左十幾分中都諗唔到 係咪智力有問題
此回覆已被刪除

如果玩9個回合，得A同K
即係其中一個款一定最少出現5次
只要可以用自己出既牌令獄友知道係A定K 就得

例如我講明第一張出既牌將會係獄長出牌中最少出現5次既牌
獄友只要永遠出果張就得

如果唔好彩第一個回合獄友撞唔中，應該係最後1，2個回合獄友可以用數牌方式調整返，撞返另一款出黎

sorry 1999

quote.msg: 諗左十幾分中都諗唔到 係咪智力有問題

replies.msg:
不用擔心，獄友可與你商討策略數小時
要提示可以出聲

1. 你知道獄長會出咩牌，所以你一定要跟佢出，輸贏就睇獄友出嘅一唔一樣

2. 就算你知道獄長會出咩牌，但你已經冇得再同獄友講。所以你講嘅策略一定要比獄友聽之餘、又唔會改變獄長出牌嘅策略

所以可以同獄友講









來生再見啦兄弟

replies.msg: 可以挑戰一個難度了

第一張拎黎做第二至四出現較多既牌
去到二至四就要睇情況
如果二至四係同一款（AAA / KKK) 咁第五張就用黎做第六至八較多出現既牌 咁已經夠5場
如果唔係同一款 (AKA) 咁唔同個隻就用黎做第五至七較多出現既牌
去到五至七一樣
如果五至七係同一款（AAA / KKK) 咁第八張就用黎做第九張既牌 咁已經6場
如果唔係同一款 (AKA) 咁唔同個隻就用黎做第八張牌 咁就有5場

獄：A K K A K A K A A
我：K K K K K A K A A
友：K K K K K K K A K
獄友唔知道 "我"將會知道獄長出牌ge前設下討論策略？

replies.msg:
high level黎睇
要尾5 round 全中, 要係頭4 round 比到5 bit information 獄友
頭4 round, 有1 round要同獄長既choice一樣, 變相比唔到information獄友
其他3 round可以各比到1 bit information
所以自己揀既牌可以比到3bit information

剩低2 bit information
如果有得揀頭4 round邊round岩, 咁就有多2bit information
問題係第1round冇可能岩, 變相最多得3揀1
估計剩低既information要由獄長頭4 round既choice到拎
聽日得閒再諗下

replies.msg:
同顏色代表獄友用我個隻提示而知道到要出咩牌

Case 1:
1st round 專登fake獄友出Ⓐ，玩左1st -4th round 後獄友知我fake左佢(因為A較多，我1stround 應出A),跟住佢就知5th-7th 牌形係BⒷB (010 or 101)
第2nd-4th round輸個2round 分別代表：5th-7th 係 010 定101 、 8th-9th係01 定10

Case 2:
1st round 正常，2nd-4th round原本啱個兩round要專登錯其中1round，提示獄友5th-7th 牌形係BBⒷ，原本錯個round 照舊提示第8th-9th係01 定10
Case 2a: 專登錯前面個round，所以5th-7th 牌形係011
Case 2b:專登錯後面個round，所以5th-7th 牌形係100

Case 3a:
1st-4th round 正常，第5round 專登錯代表牌形係BBⒷ而且8th-9th係01

Case 3b:
1st-5th round 正常，第6round 專登錯代表牌形係BBⒷ而且8th-9th係10

未追post，唔知有人做左未，不過我即時諗到果個做6次既方法係咁：

Let A be 1 and K be 0. Now we can just think the game as matching at least 6 digits of an arbitrary 9-digit binary code a with a reference code c by a hint code b. Denote a_i as the i-th digit of a, similarly for b_i and c_i as well. The construction of c would depend on b, and the construction of b is as follows:

First we define for odd |X_{m, n}| := |\{a_i\}_{i=m}^n|, \chi_{m, n} = the majority element among X_{m, n}. Also we define ' as the complementary operator in \{0, 1\} (i.e., 1' = 0 and 0' = 1). We then construct b (and accordingly c) w.r.t the following cases:

Case 1: X_{2, 4} only contains \chi_{2, 4}
Case 2: X_{2, 4} contains exactly one \chi_{2, 4}' (and let the element be a_p)

The case 1 is easy. Let's deal with the case 2 only.

For the case 2, we further consider the following subcases:

Subcase (i): X_{5, 7} only contains \chi_{5, 7}
Subcase (ii): X_{5, 7} contains exactly one \chi_{5, 7}' (and let the element be a_q)

For the subcase (i), we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4} to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4} (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_p = \chi_{5, 7} to hint c_j = \chi_{5, 7} (for j = 5, 6, 7), and then finally b_8 = a_9 to hint c_9 = a_9. Other non-specified b_i are for matching (this would be assumed without mentioning afterwards).

For the subcase (ii), there would be two more sub-subcases to consider:

Sub-subcase (a): a_8 = a_9
Sub-subcase (b): a_8 \neq a_9

For the sub-subcase (a), we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4} to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4} (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_p = \chi_{5, 7} to hint c_j = \chi_{5, 7} (for j = 5, 6, 7), and then finally b_q = a_8 to hint c_8 = c_9 = a_8.

For the sub-subcase (b), this is the heart of this question. We would need consider even further three sub^3-cases:

sub^3-case (1): q = 5
sub^3-case (2): q = 6
sub^3-case (3): q = 7

WLOG, let p = 4.
For q = 5, we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4}' to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4}' (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_2 = \chi_{5, 7}' to hint c_5 = \chi_{5, 7}' and c_6 = c_7 = \chi_{5, 7}, and then finally b_3 = a_8 to hint c_8 = a_8 and c_9 = a_8'.

For q = 6, if a_q = 0, we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4} to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4} (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_2 = \chi_{2, 4}' to hint c_6 = 0 and c_5 = c_7 = 1, and then finally b_4 = a_8 to hint c_8 = a_8 and c_9 = a_8'. If a_q = 1, we use b_3 = \chi_{2, 4}' to hint c_6 = 1 and c_5 = c_7 = 0 instead.

For q = 7, if a_8 = 0, we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4} to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4} (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_4 = \chi_{5, 7} to hint c_j = \chi_{5, 7} (for j = 5, 6, 7), and then finally b_5 = \chi_{5, 7}' to hint c_6 = \chi_{5, 7}, c_7 = \chi_{5, 7}', c_8 = 0 and c_9 = 1. If a_8 = 1, we use b_6 = \chi_{5, 7}' to hint c_7 = \chi_{5, 7}', c_8 = 1 and c_9 = 0 instead.

複雜係複雜左啲，不過應該啱

For the subcase (i), we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4} to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4} (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_p = \chi_{5, 7} to hint c_j = \chi_{5, 7} (for j = 5, 6, 7), and then finally b_8 = a_9 to hint c_9 = a_9. Other non-specified b_i are for matching (this would be assumed without mentioning afterwards).

Sub-subcase (b): a_8 \neq a_9

For the sub-subcase (a), we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4} to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4} (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_p = \chi_{5, 7} to hint c_j = \chi_{5, 7} (for j = 5, 6, 7), and then finally b_q = a_8 to hint c_8 = c_9 = a_8.

For the sub-subcase (b), this is the heart of this question. We would need consider even further three sub^3-cases:

sub^3-case (1): q = 5
sub^3-case (2): q = 6
sub^3-case (3): q = 7

WLOG, let p = 4.
For q = 5, we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4}' to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4}' (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_2 = \chi_{5, 7}' to hint c_5 = \chi_{5, 7}' and c_6 = c_7 = \chi_{5, 7}, and then finally b_3 = a_8 to hint c_8 = a_8 and c_9 = a_8'.

For q = 6, if a_q = 0, we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4} to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4} (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_2 = \chi_{2, 4}' to hint c_6 = 0 and c_5 = c_7 = 1, and then finally b_4 = a_8 to hint c_8 = a_8 and c_9 = a_8'. If a_q = 1, we use b_3 = \chi_{2, 4}' to hint c_6 = 1 and c_5 = c_7 = 0 instead.

For q = 7, if a_8 = 0, we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4} to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4} (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_4 = \chi_{5, 7} to hint c_j = \chi_{5, 7} (for j = 5, 6, 7), and then finally b_5 = \chi_{5, 7}' to hint c_6 = \chi_{5, 7}, c_7 = \chi_{5, 7}', c_8 = 0 and c_9 = 1. If a_8 = 1, we use b_6 = \chi_{5, 7}' to hint c_7 = \chi_{5, 7}', c_8 = 1 and c_9 = 0 instead.

複雜係複雜左啲，不過應該啱

quote.msg:
未追post，唔知有人做左未，不過我即時諗到果個做6次既方法係咁：

Let A be 1 and K be 0. Now we can just think the game as matching at least 6 digits of an arbitrary 9-digit binary code a with a reference code c by a hint code b. Denote a_i as the i-th digit of a, similarly for b_i and c_i as well. The construction of c would depend on b, and the construction of b is as follows:

First we define for odd |X_{m, n}| := |\{a_i\}_{i=m}^n|, \chi_{m, n} = the majority element among X_{m, n}. Also we define ' as the complementary operator in \{0, 1\} (i.e., 1' = 0 and 0' = 1). We then construct b (and accordingly c) w.r.t the following cases:

Case 1: X_{2, 4} only contains \chi_{2, 4}
Case 2: X_{2, 4} contains exactly one \chi_{2, 4}' (and let the element be a_p)

The case 1 is easy. Let's deal with the case 2 only.

For the case 2, we further consider the following subcases:

Subcase (i): X_{5, 7} only contains \chi_{5, 7}
Subcase (ii): X_{5, 7} contains exactly one \chi_{5, 7}' (and let the element be a_q)

For the subcase (i), we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4} to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4} (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_p = \chi_{5, 7} to hint c_j = \chi_{5, 7} (for j = 5, 6, 7), and then finally b_8 = a_9 to hint c_9 = a_9. Other non-specified b_i are for matching (this would be assumed without mentioning afterwards).

For the subcase (ii), there would be two more sub-subcases to consider:

Sub-subcase (a): a_8 = a_9
Sub-subcase (b): a_8 \neq a_9

For the sub-subcase (a), we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4} to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4} (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_p = \chi_{5, 7} to hint c_j = \chi_{5, 7} (for j = 5, 6, 7), and then finally b_q = a_8 to hint c_8 = c_9 = a_8.

For the sub-subcase (b), this is the heart of this question. We would need consider even further three sub^3-cases:

sub^3-case (1): q = 5
sub^3-case (2): q = 6
sub^3-case (3): q = 7

WLOG, let p = 4.
For q = 5, we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4}' to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4}' (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_2 = \chi_{5, 7}' to hint c_5 = \chi_{5, 7}' and c_6 = c_7 = \chi_{5, 7}, and then finally b_3 = a_8 to hint c_8 = a_8 and c_9 = a_8'.

For q = 6, if a_q = 0, we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4} to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4} (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_2 = \chi_{2, 4}' to hint c_6 = 0 and c_5 = c_7 = 1, and then finally b_4 = a_8 to hint c_8 = a_8 and c_9 = a_8'. If a_q = 1, we use b_3 = \chi_{2, 4}' to hint c_6 = 1 and c_5 = c_7 = 0 instead.

For q = 7, if a_8 = 0, we pick b_1 = \chi_{2, 4} to hint c_i = \chi_{2, 4} (for i = 2, 3, 4), b_4 = \chi_{5, 7} to hint c_j = \chi_{5, 7} (for j = 5, 6, 7), and then finally b_5 = \chi_{5, 7}' to hint c_6 = \chi_{5, 7}, c_7 = \chi_{5, 7}', c_8 = 0 and c_9 = 1. If a_8 = 1, we use b_6 = \chi_{5, 7}' to hint c_7 = \chi_{5, 7}', c_8 = 1 and c_9 = 0 instead.
